oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Battle of Enotichopco [Enitachopco] scene
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color engraving, Battle of Enotichopco [sic], depicts an American officer rallying his troops while he rides a white horse. Infantrymen, wearing blue uniforms, stand with muskets ready for the Indian ambush. Other soldiers lie wounded. Two American flags wave at center. Image has a decorative border. From John Frost and W. Croome, Pictorial Life of Andrew Jackson.

General Andrew Jackson and his militia army were ambushed by Red Stick Creeks while crossing Enitachopco Creek, January 24, 1814. Jackson's army repelled the attack by using artillery. The action took place during the Creek War (1813-1814).
